What are OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER and OPTION_NFT_TOKEN, and how do they affect the behavior of a Verus gateway and ID registration?

In the context of Verus, OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER and OPTION_NFT_TOKEN are two configuration options that can be set on a gateway.

**OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER:**
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER is a configuration option with a value of 1024. When this option is not set on a gateway, the top-level ID and currency registration happen on the launch chain. This means that the gateway will register its ID and currencies on the launch chain, rather than on a separate chain. This option gives gateway operators more control over where their ID and currency registrations take place.

**OPTION_NFT_TOKEN:**
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN is a configuration option with a value of 2048. This option enables the creation of a single satoshi NFT (non-fungible token) token, which tokenizes control over the root ID. In other words, setting this option allows the creation of a unique token that represents ownership and control of the root ID. This token can be transferred, bought, and sold, giving its owner control over the root ID.

In summary, these two options allow gateway operators to customize the behavior of their gateways and ID registrations, giving them more control over their Verus infrastructure.
